resources.string: exists but is a plain file
rowToColumn called with Cursor not on a table from CalendarTrigger\'s database
" does not exist, creating new one."
Column %s does not exist, dropping and recreating table %s
"Table %s has no rows, creating new valid row."
%s in VACUUMDATA.COUNT is non-integer, replacing with new valid row.
does not exist and cannot be created
Cannot access floating time event database
CalendarTrigger cannot set events to floating time because it does not have permission to modify calendars.%s
CalendarTrigger cannot set events to floating time because it does not have permission to read from external storage where it keeps its database of floating time events.%s
CalendarTrigger cannot set events to floating time because it does not have permission to write to external storage where it keeps its database of floating time events.%s
If a box is checked, the event will retain the same wall clock time if the device\'s time zone changes. Changing a recurring event (shown in red) will change all instances.
If this box is checked, the event will retain the same wall clock time if the device\'s time zone changes."
If this box is checked, all instances of this recurring event will retain the same wall clock time if the device\'s time zone changes."
Bad active state %s for event %s, entry removed from active table.
" is all day, handled in provider"

If checked, this option causes CalendarTrigger to create a virtual contact !NextEventLocation whose address is always the location of the next event in your calendar which has a nonempty location. This can be useful if you have a satnav which can navigate to the address of a contact from your phone.
The next location feature requires read and write permission on your contacts list, and cannot be enabled because CalendarTrigger does not have that permission.%s
" You can enable permissions from the device\'s" Settings tool by selecting the Application Manager.
No log file (did you clear it?)
This is the time at which CalendarTrigger was most recently called, either directly by the user, or as a result of an alarm set by CalendarTrigger itself.
This is the time of the alarm set by CalendarTrigger the last time it was called.
This is the last audio state set by CalendarTrigger.
This is the saved audio state last set by the user before CalendarTrigger changed it.
This is the actual current audio state.
This tells if CalendarTrigger currently has a pending location update request.
This tells if CalendarTrigger is holding a wake lock.
This enables logging. The log file directory and the log file itself are created when necessary if nonexistent.
Logging cannot be enabled because CalendarTrigger does not have permission WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE.%s
This disables logging. The log file if it exists is not cleared.
This button deletes the log file. The next attempt to write to the log will automatically recreate it, so this effectively clears the log.
CalendarTrigger cannot clear the log because it does not have permission to write to external storage.%s
This button displays the log file in a scrolling window: press the back button to return to this screen.
CalendarTrigger cannot show the log because it does not have permission to read external storage.%s

If checked, this option causes CalendarTrigger to once per day delete all log entries older than 24 hours. This can be used to leave logging active over along period without the log file getting too big.
Log cycling cannot be enabled because CalendarTrigger does not have permission to read and write external storage.%s.

This button forces all classes to be inactive and stops all temporary waits. It is for use if the application gets stuck or if you have deleted a calendar event while it was active. Note that if you are between the start and finish times of a calendar event, any class(es) to which that event belongs will immediately become active again.
This button writes CalendarTrigger\'s settings to a file.
CalendarTrigger cannot save settings because it does not have permission to write to external storage.%s
This button deletes all of CalendarTrigger\'s current settings and replaces them with the settings from the Settings file.
CalendarTrigger cannot load settings because it does not have permission to read from external storage.%s
Long press here for help information.

This screen allows you to define the characteristics of class %s or delete it. When you have done, press the back button. A long press on any of the buttons below will bring up some help information about it.
This button deletes class %s and cancels any actions scheduled for calendar events in this class. This action cannot be undone. The events themselves are not affected.
Conditions for a calendar event to be in class %s
Define the conditions for a calendar event to be in class %s. An event can be in more than one class: in that case it will trigger the action(s) for each class it belongs to.

This screen allows you to specify the conditions for a calendar event to be in class %s. All conditions must be satisfied for the event to be in the class, but each condition has a default option which is satisfied by any event. When you have done, press the back button. A long press on any of the controls below will bring up some help information about it.
An event is in class %s if:-
the event is in any of the calendars below which is checked

If no calendar is checked, the event can be in class %s if it is in any calendar. Note that this is different from checking all calendars: if a new calendar is added later, it will not be included unless you explicitly edit the class again.
If this is checked, the event can be in class %s if it is in calendar %s.
Choose events whose event name contains the match string to be in class %s. An empty match string always matches. If the match string is long you can drag the line to the left or right.
Choose events whose event name does not contain the match string to be in class %s. An empty match string always matches. If the match string is long you can drag the line to the left or right.
Choose events whose event location contains the match string to be in class %s. An empty match string always matches. If the match string is long you can drag the line to the left or right.
Choose events whose event location does not contain the match string to be in class %s. An empty match string always matches. If the match string is long you can drag the line to the left or right.
Choose events whose event descritpion contains the match string to be in class %s. An empty match string always matches. If the match string is long you can drag the line to the left or right.

Choose events whose event description does not contain the match string to be in class %s. An empty match string always matches. If the match string is long you can drag the line to the left or right.

Click here to select whether the event name should contain or not contain the match string for the event to be in class %s. An empty match string always matches. If the match string is long you can drag the line to the left or right.

Click here to select whether the event location should contain or not contain the match string for the event to be in class %s. An empty match string always matches. If the match string is long you can drag the line to the left or right.

Click here to select whether the event description, should contain or not contain the match string for the event to be in class %s. An empty match string always matches. If the match string is long you can drag the line to the left or right.

Click here to select the event name, the event location, or the event description to be tested to contain the match string for the event to be in class %s. An empty match string always matches. If the match string is long you can drag the line to the left or right.

Click here to select the event name, the event location, or the event description to be tested not to contain the match string for the event to be in class %s. An empty match string always matches. If the match string is long you can drag the line to the left or right.

Choose events whose description contains a specific character string. An empty match string matches any event description or an event with no description at all. If the match string is longyou can drag the line to the left or right.

Choose events whose description does not contain a specific character string. An empty match string matches any event description or an event with no description at all. If the match string is longyou can drag the line to the left or right.
Determine whether events which are busy, not busy, or either (the default), can be in class %s.
If this is checked, events which are busy can be in class %s
If this is checked, events which are not busy can be in class %s
if this is checked, both events which are busy and events which are not busy can be in class %s
Determine whether events which are or are not all day events, or either (the default), can be in class %s.
If this is checked, events which are all day can be in class %s
If this is checked, events which are not all day can be in class %s
If this is checked, both events which are all day and events which are not all day can be in class %s
Determine whether events which are recurrent, not recurrent, or either (the default), can be in class %s.
If this is checked, events which are recurrent can be in class %s
If this is checked, events which are not recurrent can be in class %s
If this is checked, events which are either recurrent or not recurrent can be in class %s
Determine whether events for which you are the organiser, or not the organiser, or either (the default), can be in class %s.
If this is checked, events for which you are the organiser can be in class %s
If this is checked, events for which you are not the organiser can be in class %s
If this is checked, events for which you either are or are not the organiser can be in class %s
Determine whether events which are private, public, or either (the default), can be in class %s.
If this is checked, events which are private can be in class %s
If this is checked, events which are public can be in class %s
If this is checked, events which are either private or not private can be in class %s
Determine whether events which have attendees, or do not have attendees, or either (the default), can be in class %s.

If this is checked, events which have attendees can be in class %s. Note that some calendar editors erroneously set the have attendees flag for all events: if you use such an editor, this test is not very useful.

If this is checked, events which have attendees can be in class %s. Note that some calendar editors erroneously set the have attendees flag for all events: if you use such an editor, this test is not very useful.
If this is checked, events can be in class %s regardless of whether or not they have attendees.
Define the conditions for the event start action(s) to be triggered for an event in class %s.

This screen allows you to define when the start action(s) for an event in class %s will be triggered. This can be a set number of minutes (defaulting to zero) before or after the start time of the event, possibly delayed until the device is in some particular state. When you have done, press the back button. A long press on any of the controls below will bring up some help information about it.
Do start action(s) for an event in class %s:-

This defines the number of minutes (which may be zero) before or after the start time of the event at which CalendarTrigger will begin to consider triggering the event\'s start action(s). This may however be delayed by other conditions below.
Choose whether the minutes count is before or after the start of the event
Choose whether the minutes count is before or after the end of the event
Here you can delay the start action(s) until the device is in some particular state.

Here you can delay the %s action(s) until the device is in some particular orientation. If no box is checked, no orientation check is performed. The orientation check is performed every five minutes until it is satisfied. This can drain the battery if it has to wait for a long time.
Device is lying on a horizontal surface with the display facing upwards.
Device is lying on a horizontal surface with the display facing downwards.
and the device is connected to any of

Here you can delay the start action(s) until the device is connected to (or not connected to) a particular kind of charger or a USB peripheral via a USB on-the-go cable. If no box is checked, there is no connection test.

Here you can delay the end action(s) until the device is connected to (or not connected to) a particular kind of charger or a USB peripheral via a USB on-the-go cable. If no box is checked, there is no connection test.
The device is on a wireless charger.
The device is connected to an adaptive fast charger: this is a special type of USB charger which adjusts it charging voltage depending on the state of the device\'s battery.
The device is connected to a plain USB charger, or to a computer which can supply charging power as well as possibly supporting a USB data connection.
Device is connected to a USB peripheral such as a mouse or a memory stick via a USB on-the-go cable.
Device is not connected to anything via its USB port and is not on a wireless charger either.
If this is checked, CalendarTrigger will send a message for the start of the event. Sending messages may incur a cost.
This option is disabled because your device has neither an email sending application nor an SMS text message sending application available.
Send message by email: if email is not available at the time or the specified contact has no email address, no message will be sent.
This option is disabled because your device does not have an email sending service available.

Send message by email if possible; if email is not available at the time or the specified contact has no email address, send message by SMS text; if SMS text messaging is also not available at the time or the specified contact has no mobile number, no message will be sent.
This option is disabled because your device does not have both an email sending service and an SMS text message sending service available.
Send message by SMS text: if SMS text is not available at the time or the specified contact has no mobile number, no message will be sent.
This option is disabled because your device does not have an SMS text sending service available.

Send message by SMS text if possible; if SMS text is not available at the time or the specified contact has no mobile number, send message by email; if email is also not available at the time or the specified contact has no email address, no message will be sent.
This option is disabled because your device does not have both an email sending service and an SMS text message sending service available.

Specify message destinations. Sending an email message requires an email address either typed in or extracted from a contact. Sending an SMS text message requires a mobile number either typed in or extracted from a contact. A contact can be named explicitly or decoded from the event name.
Send message to an email address
This option is disabled because the message is not being sent by email.
Email address for message, not checked for validity: if it is empty, no message is sent.
Send message to a phone number
This option is disabled because the message is not being sent by SMS text.
Mobile number for message, not checked for validity: if it is empty, no message is sent.
This option is disabled because the message is not being sent by either email or SMS text.
This option is disabled because CalendarTrigger does not have permission to read contacts. You can enable this permission from the device\'s Settings tool by selecting the Application Manager.
Contact to whom to send the message. As you type in the name it is displayed in red until the name matches a contact with an email address or a mobile phone number, when the colour changes to green.
Contact to whom to send the message. As you type in the name it is displayed in red until the name matches a contact with an email address, when the colour changes to green.
Contact to whom to send the message. As you type in the name it is displayed in red until the name matches a contact with a mobile number when the colour changes to green.
Send message to a contact whose name is extracted from the name of the event.
This option is disabled because the message is not being sent by either email or SMS text.
This option is disabled because CalendarTrigger does not have permission to read contacts. You can enable this permission from the device\'s Settings tool by selecting the Application Manager.
Define how to extract the contact\'s first name from the event name.
Position (from 0) of the contact\'s first name from the start or end of the event name.
Define how to extract the contact\'s first name from the event name.
Define how to extract the contact\'s st name from the event name.
Position (from 0) of the contact\'s last name from the start or end of the event name.
Define how to extract the contact\'s last name from the event name.
Remove , or \'s from first name and last nam of contact before searching contacts list.
This option is disabled because the message is not being sent to a contact from the event name.

Use the event class name, the event name, the event description, or some explicit text as the body of the message. If nothing is selected or the resulting message body is empty, no message will be sent.
Message with the event class name as its body
Message with the event name as its body
Message with the event description as its body
Message with typed text as its body
Text typed here is sent as the message

Use the event class name, the event name, the event description, or some typed in text as the subject of the message. If nothing is selected, or the resulting subject is empty, the message will be sent with an empty subject.
Message with the event class name as its subject
Message with the event name as its subject
Message with the event description as its subject
Message with typed text as its subject
Define the action(s) to be triggered at or before the start of an event in class %s.
This screen allows you to define what action(s) are performed for the start of an event in class %s. A long press on any of the controls below will bring up some help information about it.

Click this button to go to the notification policy controller which will allow you to give CalendarTrigger permission to set or clear Do not disturb mode. Then press the back button to return to this screen.
At start of an event in class %s:-

This sets the state of the audio during the event. CalendarTrigger will only set the audio to a state \"weaker\" than it is already in, as set by the user or an overlapping event. Silent is weaker than alarms-only which is weaker than muted which is weaker than do-not-disturb which is weaker than vibrate which is weaker than normal ringtone.
the normal mode in which all notification sounds are played and the phone can ring: since CalendarTrigger will only set a weaker mode, this is effectively \"no change\"
the device will vibrate instead of playing a ringtone
a do not disturb mode which can be configured from the device\'s settings page
This option is disabled because CalendarTrigger does not have permission ACCESS_NOTIFICATION_POLICY to set do not disturb mode. You can request this permission by clicking the button above.
The device\'s operating system does not support this option.
the phone will not ring but other sounds may be played
only alarms (as defined by Android) will sound
This option is disabled because CalendarTrigger does not have permission ACCESS_NOTIFICATION_POLICY to set alarms only mode. You can request this permission ny clicking the button above.
all sounds including media play are suppressed
This option is disabled because CalendarTrigger does not have permission ACCESS_NOTIFICATION_POLICY to set silent mode. You can request this permission ny clicking the button above.
If this is checked, CalendarTrigger will show a notification at the start of the event. The way in which the notification is presented depends on the user\'s notification settings.

If this is checked, CalendarTrigger will play a sound at the start of the event. The sound can be selected using a file browser. If this class mutes the audio, the sound will not be heard. Use a separate class to play the sound before the start of the event.
If this is checked, CalendarTrigger will play a sound at the end of the event. The sound can be selected using a file browser.
Click here to browse for a sound file
Click here to browse for a different sound file
Define the conditions for the event end action(s) to be triggered for an event in class %s.

This screen allows you to define when the end action(s) for an event in class %s will be triggered. This can be a set number of minutes (defaulting to zero) before or after the end time of the event, possibly delayed until the device has moved by some distance or is in some particular state. When you have done, press the back button. A long press on any of the controls below will bring up some help information about it.
Do end action for an event in class %s:-

This defines the number of minutes (which may be zero) before or after the end time of the event at which CalendarTrigger will begin to consider triggering the event\'s end action. It may however be delayed by other conditions below.
Here you can delay the end action until something else has happened or the device is in some particular state.

Delay the end action until the user holding the device has taken a specified number of steps. This can be useful if the event is a meeting and you do not want to re-enable the ringer until the meeting has ended and you have walked out of the meeting room. A nonzero number will increase battery drain because the device has to monitor the step counter.
This option is disabled because the device does not support a step sensor.
The device has moved by the user taking

Delay the end action until the device has moved by a specified number of metres. This can be useful if the event is in a building and you do not want to re-enable the ringer until you have left the building. The position resolution is of the order of 100 metres (better if the building has Wi-Fi or the device uses GPS) so you should not make this number too small. If it is zero there is no movement test. A nonzero number will increase battery drain because the device has to monitor its position.

This option is disabled because CalendarTrigger does not have permission ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION to create a Geofence. You can enable this permission from the device\'s Settings tool by selecting the Application Manager.
Define the action(s) to be triggered at or after the end of an event in class %s.
This screen allows you to define what actions are performed at the end of an event in class %s. A long press on any of the controls below will bring up some help information about it.
At end of an event in class %s:-

If this is checked, CalendarTrigger will restore the original ringer mode at the end of the event, provided that the user has not changed the mode in the meantime and no other overlapping event is requiring a \"weaker\" mode.
If this is checked, CalendarTrigger will show a notification at the end of the event. The way in which the notification is presented depends on the user\'s notification settings.

This button triggers a temporary event of class %s which starts immediately and then ends immediately. It can be useful when the class provides a movement delay on its end action, if for example you walk into a quiet room and want to mute your ringer until you leave the room again.
: this may be a permission problem
. This cannot happen because we had to use a SensorManager to register a listener in order to get here.

" because "CalendarTrigger no longer has permission ACCESS_NOTIFICATION_POLICY. It needs this permission to set do not disturb mode. You can enable this permission from the device\'s Settings tool by selecting the Application Manager.

"Cannot read phone state because CalendarTrigger no longer has permission READ_PHONE_STATE. It needs this permission to prevent it from muting while a call is active. You can enable this permission from the device\'s Settings tool by selecting the Application Manager.
Exited doLogCycling because log cycling disabled
Exited doLogCycling because not time yet
"No GPS, available, requesting first fine location for class "
"No message sent because of empty message body for "
"CalendarTrigger does not have permission to send an SMS message for "
